inn1.comm: almost a yorker to start off, up there at 140 kph just outside off. Wade digs it out.
Wade's away with a tucked single to midwicket. Malinga goes too straight and Wade pushes to midwicket and takes off. Surprise, surprise, Chandimal missed the stumps..
back of a length to Warner, which is wise. Warner stays back and defends to the off side.
keeps it short of a length and cuts it away. Warner opens the face and guides it square.
and again, Warner stays back in the crease and blocks to cover. Looking to build a long innings?
fuller length, defended to the off side off the front foot to end the over. Solid start from Lasith.
short of a length and angled across at a friendly pace. Wade resists having a jab at it.
that kicks up from short of a length and jags away off the seam. Wade defends from the crease.
another leave outside off as Kula seams it away beautifully.
width and Wade's away. He camps back in the crease and forces it through the covers for a boundary. Is this outfield quick or what!

suicidal! Wade's gone to a soft dismissal and he can't believe he has holed out in such loose fashion. Pitched a touch further up by Kula, and the ball seemed to come through in slow motion. Wade was on the front foot early and into the drive even as it came on, and popped it up straight and simple to wide mid-off.

Forrest gets away with four. Kula drops short and wide enough for Forrest to wait and steer through backward point. Malinga made a strange feet-first dive after moving across from third man, but couldn't stop the ball. This pitch seems full of runs.

Warner's turn to ping the off side boundary now.  Nearly. He waits and gets into a good position to bottom-hand a cover drive into the ground and over the infield. The ball is fielded near the rope and they get three.
Forrest stays behind the line and defends to the off side.
whipped across at 144.8 kph, Forrest shoulders arms.
Forrest gets into an organised defensive push from the crease. Played into the off side.
fuller and straighter, Forrest again defends in composed fashion.
late wake up call for Sanga, who fumbles a dodgy take behind the stumps. Australia gets a bye.
Kula pitches it up on a full length, very wide of off stump. Forrest leaves.
back of a length at 131 kph, Forrest stays in the crease and defends to the off side. He wants a single too, but Warner barks out "No!"
Sri Lanka's fielding continues to be top class. Forrest chops off the back foot, but Dilshan tears across and dives to stop it with his left hand and cut off the single.
Forrest defends again from the crease into the off side.
Forrest leans out to meet a full length ball and steers it to third man for one.
Warner goes deep in the crease and tries to scythe through the covers, but there's no room or length to work with. Played softly to cover.
Forrest is middling his defensive strokes. Stays in the crease and pushes Malinga to mid-off.

if Forrest were Sehwag, he'd have been caught at third man. But since he's not, he doesn't time the upper cut well enough to carry. Short ball outside off, Forrest climbs on it and carves on the bounce to Maharoof. They hustle back for the second.
good-looking shot. Another short ball, this time Forrest played it earlier, and slapped it with a horizontal bat into the covers for three.
good bouncer ... Or so I thought. The umpire's called it a wide. Fair call, it was quite high, considering how small-built Warner is. He was setting up for the pull, but let the ripper go through.
easier call for wide this time as Malinga whangs it down the leg side.
short of a length on the pads, nice slower ball from Malinga. Warner tries to work it square but can't get it away.
Warner shakes off the coma. Slipping into the pads, he tucks it with the angle through backward square leg.
back of a length on the stumps, Forrest is nicely back and across to defend it.
Warner stays in the crease and defends with bat and pad close together to the leg side.
defensive again is Warner. He looks determined for a long vigil today. Got a rousing 100 last time he batted here ...
offcutter of sorts, defended to the off side with an opened face.
on the pads, Warner nudges it behind square for a single.
Forrest opens the face and defends to the off side.
Forrest is early lunging out to a full ball and manages to squeeze it away behind square for a single.
back of a length outside off stump, Forrest lets it go.
and a slower ball already. The legspinning variety, full outside off stump, and Forrest defends watchfully to the off side.
short and angling in, Forrest taps to the leg side and rotates the strike.

David's un-Warneresque innings is over, and Sri Lanka continue to torment Australia. Gentle, probing delivery outside off from Maharoof, it angled away from short of a length as Warner went back to defend. He ended up nicking it straight into Sanga's gloves for a dolly.
length ball to Clarke, who gets behind the line first up and defends.
wide of off stump, Clarke watches it whiz by to the keeper.
Forrest forces through the covers for four more. The more you see of him, the more he reminds you of Watto. Back of a length outside off, he leans across and steers through cover-point.
Kula holds the length back, and Forrest defends.
short of a length outside off, Forrest opens the face as he defends to the off side.
pitched further up, Forrest is late getting forward but manages to end the defensive onto his pad and safely away.
pitched up outside off stump, defended from the crease again.
Maharoof keeps it short of a length, and Pup defends from the crease.
high elbow and good back-and-across movement from Clarke as he defends.
rolls his fingers across a slower ball, but it was too short and straight. Clarke spotted it and slapped it pleasingly behind square for four.

whoa, Clarke's pounded that one. Maharoof bowls a listlessly short length for his pace, but Clarke's response suggested he had vengeance in his mind. He rocked back and absolutely hammered the pull over square leg. It didn't go too high, but it went far enough.
better line and length, goes outside off and Clarke defends.
the damage for the over already done, Clarke chooses to stay defensive against Maharoof again.
Kula seams one into Forrest's pads and it is nudged to the leg side for a single.
Kula gets the seam movement going again, it dips into Clarke as he pushes out to drive. Bat and pad were wisely close together.
full ball wide of off stump, Clarke defends to the off side off the front foot.
another fullish ball, Clarke meets it confidently off the front foot.
back of a length on the stumps, Clarke shuffles across and works it with the angle to the leg side for a single.
Forrest stays back in the crease and steers a short ball to point who fumbles on the dive. The single is taken.
back of a length from Maharoof, Forrest defends to the off side.

too short, and Forrest thumps it away behind square with a crisp cut. The short and portly Herath scurries across from third man and puts in a timely dive to stop the ball as it was speeding away to the boundary.
slower ball on Clarke's pads, who pushes to mid-on for a single.
back of a length to Forrest, defended watchfully to the off side.
another slow, loopy legcutter. Forrest defends to the off side.
pitched up wide of off stump, and Forrest drives fluently but straight to cover.
tossed up on the stumps, worked with the angle to the leg side.
pitched up on the stumps, Clarke trots out and works it to midwicket.
skips out staying outside the line, and drives with the turn through extra cover for one.
pitched up and drifting in towards middle and leg. Forrest defends.
shorter, just outside off stump and Forrest guides it square for a single.
big drift on that from wide of the crease, and Clarke took on the dare to go back and cut. He managed to get the stroke away, but not past point.
back of a length from Maharoof, Forrest tucks it to the leg side.
another loose legspinning slower ball from Maharoof. Forrest presses out and defends to the off side watchfully.
back of a length, Forrest stays back and defends to the off side.
beaten outside off. Forrest tries the cheeky steer to a short of length ball in the corridor, and misses.
another slower ball, Forrest pushes off the front foot into the cover.
angled into the pads to end a good over. Forrest gets the single away at long last.
too straight from Herath, Forrest nudges to the leg side for one.
pitched up to Clarke, who drives it through the mid off area for a single.
Forrest looks to chip out, but the length is tight and he defends it down the track.
boink. Beauty in the violence from Forrest. He skips out to the flight, gets under the ball and tees off cleanly down the ground. That nearly carried into the Derwent River.
the length is shortened, the pace quickened slightly, and Forrest defends.
skips out again, and drives back down the track. Herath fields it.
another legspinning slower ball from Maharoof, Clarke lunges out and gets the outside edge, but it dies on Sanga, who dives and snaffles on the bounce.
pitched up on off stump, defended into the off side.
Clarke defends off the front foot again to the off side.
another legcutter variety slower ball, Clarke defends into the cover.
Clarke works a length ball across the line, wide of Malinga at mid-on for a single.
short ball, Forrest muscles it away with a workman-like pull between midwicket and mid-on for three. Uppish, but he knew where it was going.
full ball to start off his spell, Forrest defends it back down the track.
slower ball, over-pitched on the stumps and Forrest drives down the ground for a single.
on the pads, Clarke tucks it with the angle to square leg for a single.
back of a length outside off, Forrest tries to force it square, but can't get it away.
Forrest hacks a single into the covers.
full ball to Clarke, played back to Mathews off the front foot.
Maharoof angles another one into the pads, Clarke works it to the leg side.
angled into the pads, worked to square leg watchfully.

he nearly gets Clarke undone with the back of the hand slower ball. Very similar to how he dismissed Ponting the other day. The ball stopped short of a length and jumped up to hit the bat near the splice. It nearly carried back to Maharoof...
another slower ball, too straight this time and Clarke slaps it away behind square for one.
pitched further up, defended off the front foot.
slower ball on the pads, Clarke whips it away through midwicket, where Maharoogf back flips the ball to a relay fielder and keeps it down to two.
too straight, easy run for Clarke who clips it off the pads behind square.
short of a length outside off stump, Forrest defends to the off side.
fuller length, Forrest stays on the crease and defends to the off side of the pitch.
slipping down the leg side, Forrest misses the whip and gets hit on the pad.
on the pads once more, Forrest gets the single away through square leg this time.
length ball on Forrest's pads, and he tucks it to midwicket.
Maharoof's slower ball makes another appearance. On a full length, and defended off the front foot.
another one that nips away off the straight as he rolls it out of the fingers. Forrest defends.
goes fuller at 111 kph, Forrest plays away too many dot balls, doesn't he?
short ball, enough in it for Forrest to jump back and heave through square leg for one.
Clarke chips out to make some pace of his own, and tucks Maharoof down to backward square leg for one.
slower ball again, straightens from outside off. Clarke steers it to third man for a single.
pitched up on the pads, Forrest works it to wide mid-on for a single.
Clarke works him in front of square for one.
short and bashed away. Forrest removes some of the rust with a powerful pull shot to a half-tracker from Mathews. Easy pickings.
full length wide of off stump, draws Forrest forward and he steers to the off side.
Maharoof drifts onto the pads, Clarke nudges yet another single behind square leg.
pitched well up to Forrest, who is reluctant to come forward but defends solidly down the line.
short of a length outside off, chopped towards point.
back of a length again, Forrest defends from the crease into the off side.
and a slower ball to finish with, Forrest lunges out and has to adjust and defend. He's played 50 dot balls now!
full ball to Clarke, who drives solidly to mid on.
full ball again, Forrest looks to thread the covers but finds the fielder.
gets the single now, pushing a full ball towards long-on.
on the pads now, Clarke tucks a single through square leg.
Forrest beavers a full ball wide of mid-on for a single.
pitched up on the stumps to end the over, Clarke pushes to mid on.
short of a length outside off to start with, steers square for no runs.
short of a length again, Forrest is getting stuck. Steered straight to point.
back of a length outside off, steered behind point now. And he gets the single.
pitched up to Clarke who leans out to defend to the off side.
Clarke uses Perera's lines to work a couple through the square field. He's looking the more fluent of the two.
full ball on the stumps, defended down the track.
tossed up on the stumps, driven down the ground for a single.
angled down the leg side, Clarke turns it square for a single now.
armer, Forrest hangs back and chops it away as it hurries in towards the stumps.
Clarke drives down the ground for a single.
full toss, Forrest skips out and drives to long-off for a single.
Clarke plays into the covers carefully to end the over.
Forrest is getting bogged down, defends a length ball to the off side.
Thisara cuts one in, Forrest is cramped as he defends to the off side.

in the middle of all the dots, he's played some outrageously powerful strokes, just like this one. Thisara drops short, Forrest leans back and whacks it over midwicket for four. That's yet another fifty for the new man.
back of a length, he looks to beat point with the dab but can't
slower ball outside off, Forrest steers it with thew deviation towards point.
angled into the pads, Forrest works it behind square for a single to end the over.
tossed up to Forrest, who plays it from the crease.
pushed back in the crease by an armer, Forrest plays it straight to cover as he looks to heave.
top shot from Forrest, gets a proud front foot thrust and thumps through the covers. The sweeper on the off side thought he could have cut it off, but the ball sped past.
gets a single now into the covers.
Clarke turns a straight ball from the pads towards square leg.
Forrest works Herath straight to cover.
Ravi Shastri's voice trembles with excitement on air as Clarke plays a cracking pull without bothering to go back after getting the front foot out. Comprehensively thumped.
fuller ball on the stumps, Clarke gets the side wide of mid on.
pitched up on the leg stump, but Forrest can't encash the freebie. He works it straight to the leg side.

Forrest is cutting loose now. Australia are enjoying a belated step up in the run-rate. Another shortish ball from Thisara, Forrest was onto it like a dog to a bone. He got inside the line and heaved it over midwicket, to the right of the sweeper in the deep.
gets the single now with a quiet nudge to the leg side.
Clarke's turn to work a single. Sri Lanka are sweating now.
tossed up on the stumps, Clarke pushes it to mid-on.
tossed up again, Clarke skips out and plays it  back to the bowler.

aha, Maharoof has gone swimming in the deep but the ball's slipped out of his grasp. Short ball to Clarke, whose eyes glint with greed as he rocks back and pulls. He timed it well enough, and Maharoof wasn't well back on the ropes.
advances this time, but plays it off a slight leading edge to the left of Herath.
gets too close to the pitch and plays a full ball back to Herath.
Clarke drives the last ball through long-on for a single.
full length ball wide of off stump, Clarke carves through the covers for a single.
pitched up to Forrest, who works it to the leg side feebly. Malinga moves across to clean up.
pitched up wide of off stump, Forrest digs it out square.
over-pitched outside off, Forrest can't get the flowing drive away through the covers.
gets the single this time, steering an over-pitched ball wide of off stump to the left of cover.
yorker outside off, Clarke jams down on it and keeps it out.
back of a length outside leg and turning in. Forrest can't work it away.
pitched up and turning in, Forrest misses the sweep now.
Forrest advances, gets to the flight and drives to mid off.
gets the sweep away behind square as Herath continues to operate outside leg stump.
Clarke has 1000 runs against SL. He skips out and drives with the angle to deep mid-on. These two have added 100.
tossed up on the stumps, Clarke sweeps it to deep backward square leg for one.
full ball wide of off stump, Forrest guides into the covers for a single.
full and wide to Clarke, who drives a single into the covers ... Clarke's bat has broken at the handle.
pitched up to Forrest, who forces it to mid-on.
slower ball at 126 kph, and it swung in the air as it came through. Forrest did well to play it back down the track.
times the clip off the pads well, and places it between mid-on and midwicket for a couple.
Forrest looks to drive into the covers, but can't pierce the infield.
back of a length on the stumps to start off, Clarke is inside the line and nudges it to square leg fir one.
slower ball, nips away off a length, Forrest defends to the off side.
if it's in his slot he can murder them. Over-pitched in the amiable area where a batsman can reach out and get to the pitch. Forrest obliged and smashed it through the covers sumptuously.
Kula responds with a full indipper, Forrest nearly played all over it. He managed to get a leading edge that went very fine. Sanga stops it.
angled into the pads, Forrest gets the single to midwicket.
stifled lbw appeal as Clarke walks across and looks to work Kula to the leg side. Pitched, and hit the pads, outside the line of off stump.
slower ball, swinging in the air towards the middle and leg line. Forrest whips him square for a single.
length ball, too wide of the stumps and Clarke lays into it with a cut shot. Dilshan is in the way at backward point.
full pace yorker, slips down the leg side and goes off Clarke's pad to the leg side for one.

Forrest flexes his biceps and carts Malinga over mid-off with a clean shovel-drive on the up. Malinga's attempted yorker ends up an over-pitched length ball and Forrest smacks his lips even as he dispatches it.
hurls down a late swinging (reverse?) yorker at Forrest's toes. He couldn't lay bat on it, and was hit on the boot but it was slipping down the leg.
superb stroke. Another yorker that swung in late towards the pads, Forrest ensured he brought the bat down in time to flick it off the meat through square leg.
Clarke does the wise thing, walks across to off stump and nudges a single to hand it over to Forrest. Ah well, he places it well enough for two ...
does it again, this time in front of square for a single.
Forrest blazes through the covers once more, Mathews has acreage to cover in the deep as he moves to his left, and they get two more.
over-pitched outside off, Forrest clubs it to long-off for another single.
Clarke tries to work a full ball to the leg side and gets a leading edge down the track. Kula stops it with his boot.
Clarke has 50 now, nudging a length ball with the angle towards square leg.
another slower ball pitched up on the stumps, worked with the angle to the leg side for a single.
drop in pace again, worked with the angle to the leg side for a single once more.
full length wide of off stump, Clarke tries to carve it into the cover-point area but didn't have the room to generate the power. He finds point.

Clarke's launched him. Expert batting this, Clarke spots the shorter boundary and finds the gap too as he lofts a length ball over the leg side. It takes off and comes down at deep midwicket, between two converging fielders and away for four.

even better. Clarke swings a lovely little arc to swish a shoddy delivery out of the park. It sails into the grassbanks behind square leg, where the spectator puts down a catch. Sri Lanka are taking a hammering in the PP.
slow offcutter to start off, Forrest spots it late and defends.
angled into the pads, Forrest works it with the angle behind square for one.

Clarke's playing the fields superbly here. The field is back on the leg side, and Malinga's keeping it very straight, but Clarke is good enough to make room, open his wrists and carve it over the covers. He even times it beautifully, and it carries almost 80% of the way to the boundary.
Malinga drops short as Clarke advances to target the covers again. This time he latches on late and the ball flies off the outer half of the bat towards third man. Clarke flies back for the second.
on Clarke's pads, he nudges it straight to backward square leg and Clarke sends Forrest back. Direct hit doesn't catch him short.
full and wide of off stump, Clarke scythes into the off side. 43 runs have come off the Powerplay, timely gear change for the Aussies, who have 14 overs to go.
Clarke pushes a single in front of square.
full ball on the stumps, Forrest is stuck on the crease but manages to tuck it to midwicket for one.
short of a length on the stumps, Clarke turns it to deep midwicket for another single.
slower ball at 115 kph, Forrest opens the face and defends towards point.
angled in from over the stumps, Forrest tucks it to square leg watchfully.
another slower ball to wind up the spell, Forrest spots it late and defends watchfully down the track.
armer and a loud lbw appeal as Clarke dares to go back and cut. He chops the pad with his bat after hitting the ball, hence no response from the umpire barring a smile.
angled in towards the pads, Forrest can't get it away.
Forrest skips out and drives down the ground for a single.
Clarke sweeps from outside off stump for a single to deep square leg.
tossed up slow and gentle on the stumps, Forrest plays it back down the track.
good ball to end the over, keeps Forrest in the crease and makes him defend to the off side.

a stunning catch and Clarke's gone. Full ball angling into the pads, Clarke swipes it efficently over midwicket, and he times it well enough to give Thisara on the boundary a chance. And how well he took it.. He ran across and to his front, tumbled forward and plucked the ball just before it hit turf. Sri Lanka will breathe easy ...
he's away immediately, working Angelo Mathews efficiently away for a single.
full length to Forrest, who plays it back to the bowler.
104 kph on that offcutter, Hussey wasn't close to spotting it. Nearly nicked it, but it wouldn't have carried to the keeper.
opens the face as he looks to steer square now, but finds point.
Thisara rolls down a legspinning slower ball down the leg side. It is called a wide.
he's over-doing it. This time the slower ball release goes all awry and it slips out a full toss outside off. Forrest thankfully drives it through the covers for four more. 98 now.
can't squeeze away those two yet. Dilshan is again in the way, diving away from point to stop the steer.
Forrest is up to 99. Gets back in the crease and guides behind point for a single.

Hussey murders a long hop! Looks like he was getting anxious to come out and bat during that stand. Short ball, Hussey is back in a flash and bangs it into oblivion., It lands well back in the grass banks.
fuller length, Hussey calmly tucks it square for a single.

Forrest has his first 100 in the one-day format, at all levels. And he's chuffed! Short of a length outside off, he defends to the off side with soft hands and prances away. He was pumping his fist even as he was getting there, his eyes popping in joy and a yell of "Yes!" He jumps and skips. That's also the first century of the CB series.
time for some fun now. He gets room outside off and shreds him through point for four more.

Forrest holes out, without quite indulging himself in the post-century celebrations. As always, the slower ball does the job for SL. Mathews held it back, Forrest backed away for a carve, and was early into the loft over the covers and teed it straight up in the air. Simple catch in the deep cover area.
back of a length outside the off stump, Hussey chops it square for a single.
Hussey reaches out to a length ball and nurdles it to the leg side. Thirimanne makes a hash of a routine pick-up-and-throw, but only two runs to be had in any case.
107 kph on a slower ball, David Hussey is early into the work to leg and plays it uppishly but short of catchers.
David plays his trademark walking steer into the covers for a single.
length ball wide of off stump, David steers it straight to point.
full ball, pings the covers for a single.
yorker from Kula outside off stump, Mike digs it out beside the stumps and little bro responds for a quick single.
another legcutter slower ball, David kills it with a front-foot inside out carve over extra cover.
and again, he scuds a full ball through the extra cover area. Thisara does well to move across, but almost lets it go through with a lazy one-handed pick up, but he keeps it down to two eventually.
pitched up on off stump, David deflects it into the off side again.
slower ball, short outside leg, and Hussey nearly laps it straight to Kula at short fine leg. Would have been a travesty if it had carried, but it dropped just short.
over-pitched wide of off stump, David pushes into the covers for another single.
back of a length outside off, Michael stays in the crease and forces it down to long-off for one.

murder in Tasmania. Slower ball to David, who waits and waits before blasting it across the line miles over midwicket. The slower ball can be pesky to batsmen who commit themselves early, but David Hussey isn't one of those ...
full ball outside off now, David eases it into the covers without fuss for two more.

David Hussey is having a good time at Angelo Mathews' expense. Length ball outside off, and he once again times the lofted jab over the covers beautifully. Herath runs across and tries to play footsie instead of going down and stopping cleanly, but the ball rolls over.
full length ball outside the off stump, Michael dabs to point for one.
pitched well up on the stumps, David works it away through midwicket and Michael runs back without any sort of trouble for what looked like a difficult couple.
another single for David, who bunts a full length ball to long-on.

what's worse than Hussey going bonkers at one end? Hussey going bonkers at both. Kula sends down a listless full toss, which ends up in Michael's slot as he moves across and lines up a lap. He ends up timing it so well, it flies out of the park. Stunning timing.
wheels are a-coming off. Misfield in the covers gives Michael too as he jams a full ball away. The understanding between these two is something else.
Kula gets a dot ball through at long last, back of a length and cutting away from Mike.
DJ makes room even as Malinga sends down a full ball outside off. He pushes into the covers and looks for a quick single, but he played it straight to the fielder.
DJ plays all over a full ball, but the inside edge runs away behind square for a couple.
good yorker outside off, DJ plays it right back to the bowler.
DJ gets the single away, forcing a mistimed single through mid-on.

Malinga's making his worth apparent. The inch-perfect yorker from hell, full, ram-rod straight and destined to hit the base of the stumps. Michael was looking to play the cheeky dab to third man, but he was messing with the wrong man. Wrong ball in any case. It's through him, and the bails fly off.
very low full toss on Christian's toes and he clips efficiently for a couple.. Sri Lanka's fielding is fading away a touch here.
back of a length on off stump, DJ takes a risky single.. Chandimal hurls it down at the non-striker's end from point, but misses fractionally.
Christian laps him away from outside off stump towards fine leg for a couple.
hint of turn from a length on middle stump, Christian plays it back to the bowler.
works him from middle and leg towards midwicket and charges back for a second run to usher in the 250.
drifts in towards leg stump, Christian plays all around it, but manages to keep it out;.

a wicket to end a splendid over under the circumstances. Herath holds the length back sending Christan's rampant charge, and slips the ball past his murderous heave to the leg side. Sanga doesn't grasp the ball cleanly, but holds on to break the furniture.
perfect yorker from Malinga, DJ can't time the flick past the man at midwicket..
DJ can only jam a single away, one bounce and past mid-off.. Brett Lee will face.
superb from Malinga. Invaluable skill this! Lee tamely plays a searing yorker right back to the bowler.
almost another perfect yorker, this time Lee manages to drive to long-on for a single.
another late swinging yorker, DJ steers into the covers for a single. The Malinga overs are a write-off. What can DJ do at the other end?
pitched up on a full length outside off, Lee bangs it to long-off for a single to retain strike. Three to go.,
back of a length, Lee backs away and looks to hack into the covers. Can't find the gap.
Lee jumps out, Herath hoodwinks him in the air, but Lee is resourceful enough to steer behind point for one.,
angled into the pads, DJ carefully works it square for a single.
fired in on a length, Lee can't force it away and plays back to the bowler. Asphixiation!

Lee's relieved the pressure with a stunning connection. Length from Herath, only just, and Lee gets under it to lever it away brutally over midwicket. That magic man, Mathews, was prowling in the deep, but even his leap couldn't juggle it back in.
good comeback, fired in full and Lee drags it back to Herath who reacts quickly and fields.
Malinga yorker again, DJ chops it off the inner edge past the stumps for a single.
at long last, Malinga has missed a yorker. It ends a low full toss in Lee's hitting zone and he bottom-hands it past wide mid-on for another important four.
lands this one near the toes, Lee looks to heave it square and labours a single away.
DJ seems to have lost his mojo in the last 3-4 overs, since big brother got out. Another inswinging yorker, inside edged to short fine leg for a single.

full again outside off, Lee manages to force it into the covers and prance back and forth for two. He also had to dive in at the last moment to make it in. Got to love this guy! What fitness and spirit after such a high-effort, many-injury-laden career.
Malinga's done a fine finishing job. Lee drags a single to long on to retain strike for the 50th. Australia won't mind a big finish.
gets away with a shabby full toss on the pads. Lee somehow contrived to get a leading edge on his lash to the leg side and it came right back at Kula.
another full toss, another escape. Lee tries to pulverise it over the covers and gets a thick outside edge to Sanga, who does really well to stop it as he dives to his right.

good yorker, DJ is moving about the crease and can only force it down the ground for a couple. A direct hit from the deep can't catch Lee short, and there's nearly an overthrow, but Lee's run too far.
he's bowling a dangerously high number of full tosses for the last over, and incredibly getting away with them too! Hussey lashes this one to deep square leg, but finds the fielder.
much better length, DJ hustles it down the ground for just a single.

Sri Lanka have come back strongly in the end over. Despite a needless overthrow to end the innings. Yorker to Lee, who plays it to the leg side for a single. A direct hit is attempted and missed, and the second run is taken.

inn2.comm: short and wide start from Lee. Mahela has to reach across to slap the ball square for a single.
late swing from well wide of off stump. Dilshan heaves and misses and the keeper can't collect cleanly. They get the extra run before second slip can clean up.
back of a length, still too wide of off stump. Mahela tries to carve it square... And finds point. It's not Ponting, it is Warner.
good length, and good pace. 145 kph outside off, and Mahela defends off the front foot.
short ball, Mahela guides the pull down to the ground.
back of a length outside off to complete the over. Dilshan forces it back down the track to the bowler.
sharp swing first up, the ball curls away from the line of middle and off. Mahela defends solidly.
ohho, Mahela leaps out and looks to bang him over the covers. Swing and a miss as the ball swings away.
better from Mahela, stays in the crease and defends to the off side.
a touch of width as Hilf swings it away. Mahela drives into the covers but finds the fielder.
slow offcutter, slips out and goes down the leg side past Wade for five wides.
outswinger at 145 kph, Mahela has a fiddle at it as it bends away and misses. Didn't get back and across there, and just hung the bat out to dry.
on the pads to end an indifferent over from Hilf. Mahela tucks it crisply through midwicket and runs through for three.
width outside off again, Mahela moves across nicely and drives ominously into the covers.
angled in too straight, Mahela works it square and takes a single.
deja vu from the previous game. Dilshan played some rousing pulls off Lee in that match. He goes after him at the first opportunity here, but there's protection at deep square leg.
beaten for pace by the bouncer. Mahela is hurried into the pull and is quite late on the shot. The top edge spirals up very fine towards third man, well out of the reach of fielders.
over-pitched on the stumps, Mahela slots it straight to mid-on.
back of a length outside off at 145 kph, Mahela defends to cover.
146 kph, Hilfy is cranking it up now. That angled in off the straight and cramped up Dilshan as he set himself up for an ill-advised steer to the off side.
too straight, Dilshan flicks through square leg for a single.
full ball outside off, Mahela drives to the left of mid-off
148 kph, short and wide enough outside off for Mahela to throw his bat at. The thick outside edge flies past the lone slip to the third man boundary.
better line, cuts off the width and Mahela defends.
too straight again, Mahela nudges it with the angle to square leg for a single.
slow full toss from Lee, Mahela laboriously drives into the covers but can't get the single.

we've seen some shots today, but none better than this. Length ball from Lee, steams in at pace and Mahela steps across and lofts it with the angle clean and mighty over deep midwicket. Spanked with authority.
he's looking to hit almost everything. Short and wide outside off, he again looks to carve over the off side. This time he is beaten by the pace.
more cautious with the steer this time. Uses Lee's pace well and picks up two behind point.
and again. Short and wide, Mahela cracks it with full control through backward point. This is a rousing start.
he's toying with Lee at the moment. Short again, not wide enough for the square cut, and Mahela responds with a dainty little upper cut over the head of the slip fielder.
full ball slipping down towards leg, Dilshan misses the flick and it goes off the pad to the off side. Dilshan has 1 off 6 in this fireworks display!
back of a length outside off, Mahela stays back and chops it to the off side.
fuller length ball on the stumps, Mahela works it across the line to mid-on.
146 kph and coming in towards the pads as Mahela looks to stay in the crease and play it square. Can't get it away.
full pitched outside off, Mahela is literally flowing into these drives. Doesn't pierce the covers this time.
looks to drive away from the body now and gets a thick outside edge to third man.
Mahela continues to play his shots. A length ball outside off, he leans across and eases it through cover-point for two more.
that kept low. 136 kph, short ball though not entirely a half-tracker. Mahela tried to play a guiding pull and the ball slipped through below the bat.
Mahela canters out of the crease, opens up the off side and powers a length ball over cover-point. SL are flying here.
good comeback, good length and on the off stump line., Mahela was shaping for another big shot, but adjusted well to defend.

Harris' lack of pace (relative to Lee and Hilf) is making him easy prey here.. Listless length ball at 130 kph, Mahela jumps out of the crease and crashes him with one telling swing through the covers.
and he keeps strike again! Stays back and drops a short ball towards backward point and gets the single.
short of a length, Hilf hustles Mahela with pace at 147 kph and he can't get it away off the pads.
boundaries are flying everywhere, the 50 is up. Mahela under-edges a cut and it goes straight down to the right of Clarke at slip and once it passed him, it was always going to be four.
on the pads, worked to the leg side for one.
back of a length outside off, he looks to steal a single but can't put it away.
Dilshan is away now with a sprightly square drive as he cracks open the wrists to power the ball square for two.

that's the end of Dilshan. Australia stick to the short-ball strategy for him, Dilshan takes on Hilfenhaus' bumper and pulls it in the air. He ends up timing it too well, straight to the man back at deep square leg.
full ball on middle to Mahela, who drives it back crisply. Harris gets his hand down to stop it.
angled into the pads, worked gingerly to the leg side.
Sanga on a song-a! What a glorious stroke to play on a ground so pretty in the evening sun ... Full-pitched wide of off stump, Sanga leans out and smokes it through the covers.
back of a length outside off, Sanga opens the face and drops it to the off side.
on the pads now, Sanga whips efficiently and Sri Lanka's veterans are quick enough to get three ...
short of a length, Mahela covers the line and defends it well.
back of a length outside off, Sanga defends to the off side.
keeps it tight on off and middle, Sanga defends to the leg side now.
Sanga pings the gaps in the covers again, doesn't time it that well so he gets a single. Wade misses the return in the sun that's blazing now into his eyes. No signs of darkness at 7.15 PM.
Sanga opens the face and guides with the angle to third man for a single.
back of a length on the stumps, defended by Mahela to the leg side.
full pitched on off stump, Sanga drives hard into the covers and gets the single
drives elegantly, but with great timing but not quite the best placement, a diving stop at short cover means it is a dot ball
risky shot that, carves that over cover for a couple
length ball just outside off, defended solidly by Sangakkara
slightly overpitched, around off stump, Sanga skips across and cracks that wide of midwicket for four, lovely stroke that
another graceful shot, this time towards extra cover for a single
full ball on leg stump is nudged behind square by Mahela to end a good over for Sri Lanka

superbly timed by Mahela, just a push off the front foot after Christian overpitches, the ball speeds away down the ground, nearly to the rope, but is cut off by a dive, doesn't prevent Mahela from reaching his half-century
short of length ball on off stump, guided towards backward point
innovative from Mahela, shuffles across and paddles a leg stump delivery towards fine leg
short of length ball outside off, Sanga steers it towards backward point
back of a length ball on middle and off, defended back towards the bowler
length ball heading for off stump, defended off the front foot to the off side
on leg stump this time, blocked towards midwicket
tossed up and that is driven towards cover
length ball goes on with the arm outside off, Sanga was expecting it to spin back, he goes for the drive, the ball ball goes past the outside edge
carved towards sweeper cover for a single
paddles this fine down the leg side, gets a couple for his efforts
starts with a ball way outside off
on the pads, moves across and clip it behind square leg
length ball outside off, punched towards mid-off
Sanga works another one off the pads towards the leg side for one.
back of a length outside Mahela's off stump, he chops it behind point for one.

They should really consider renaming this series the Run-out and Leading edge series. Sanga has perished against the run of play, twinkling a leading edge straight to backward point. Christian's trundler angled across at no pace, and did nothing off the pitch. Sanga tried nudging to leg and turned the face too soon. Mistake. Should have really been playing it through the off side with the angle.
Christian gets this to shape in through the air, Chandimal works it off the front off his pads to backward square leg for one.
on a length outside off, Chandimal negotiates defensively.
full ball, draws Chandimal forward and defends.
Chandimal leans out and defends to the off side.
chips out, gets too close to the pitch and squeezes it away wide of mid-on.
full ball outside off, Mahela defends watchfully.
Mahela leans out and defends to the off side again.
Christian angles into the pads, Chandimal was looking to play to the leg side and missed Struck on the pads, but sliding down the leg surely.
Chandimal encashes a gift certificate to get his first four. Christian slips another one down the leg side, and Chandimal's glance did enough to deflect it away from Wade's reach.
better line on a good length, defended to the off side.
back of a length now, Chandimal tries to nudge to leg but can't get it away.
fuller length, Chandimal leans out and drives confidently to mid-on.
short ball, Chandimal cuts hard and into the ground. A half stop at cover saves the boundary, but he comes back for the second.
majestic from Mahela, skips out to the flight and launches Doherty languidly over the mid-on fielder. Big effort from Harris running back, keeps it to two.
back of a length outside off, chopped away through backward point for one.
flighted outside off stump, Chandimal leans out to defend.
slow and loopy on off stump, Chandimal defends gingerly off the front foot.
short, pacy and wide. Shoddy bowling, and very smart batting from Chandimal who delayed the cut enough to time it well behind point.
tossed up on off stump, defended off the front foot.
tries to york him but strays outside leg stump. The runs continue to flow easily here. Chandimal whips prodigiously through backward square leg.
back of a length outside off stump, chopped to the off side carefully.
over-pitched into the stumps, worked through square leg.
short ball banged in at pace, Chandimal is hustled, he leaps and drops his wrists as it buzzes by.
fuller length at 147 kph. Chandimal defends to the leg side off the front foot.
and beaten outside off with nifty little seam movement away from the straight. Chandimal goes fishing and misses. He can have a drink now.
width to Mahela, who steers easily through the off side for a single.
Chandimal stays back and attempts a dab to the off side, but can't get the single away.

in the air, but Christian can't pull off a Dominic Cork. Slower ball, cross-seamed, it stopped on Chandimal who lunged out early top drive. It landed just short of Christian as he dived in his follow through.
Chandimal takes four more off Christian, waiting for a wide ball outside off to go past him before opening the face and running it expertly to third man.
over-pitched on the stumps, Chandimal is on the front foot and drives straight to mid-off.
length ball on the stumps, Chandimal defends down the track.
short ball outside off stump, Mahela watches it sail past through to Wade.

thrashed, with as much grace as a thrashing can possibly have. Full-pitched outside off stump, Mahela is having an extended net at the moment, playing his shots with full freedom and no worries. He leaned out to the pitch and the ball just disappeared through the covers.
gets the single away now, with another push into the off side.
short ball to Chandimal, who skips with the bounce and works it behind square.
Mahela is trying to play shots to almost every ball.. If anything this could prove his undoing. He tries another one of those cheeky slaps to a short ball outside off, and misses.
short of a length outside off, defended to the off side.
short ball angled into Mahela, who tucks it to the leg side.
Chandimal stays behind a length ball to defend down the track.
fuller length, everything right about the way Chandimal leaned out to drive that into the covers.
shorter length, Mahela stays back and guides behind point.
he gets the single away now, dabbing through to third man.
again, Chandimal presses forward and punches into the covers with consummate elegance.
full-pitched ball wide of off stump, Mahela drives to deep cover-point for one.
that came in off the seam, Chandimal defends it solidly to the leg side of the pitch.
Harris gets late inswing again. Chandimal works it to midwicket as it comes in.
slips down the leg side, Chandimal can't get bat on the glance but prances back for two legbyes.
another short ball, again slipping down the leg side. Australia are all over the place. Chandimal is inside the line and plays a controlled full very fine and keeps it down. Fine leg had no chance.
Harris' has lost it. Big wide down the leg side.
short of a length outside off, Chandimal jabs it away behind point.
Mahela goes deliberately in the air with a controlled chip over the infield. Two runs to deep extra cover.
goes behind square now, with a chiselled cut with the spin. Mahela is in complete control
dabs a short ball behind point for a single.
Doherty spins one away from a length, Chandimal prods at it and gets a single behind square on the off side.
tossed up on middle and leg, Mahela drives it past Doherty for a single.
the milking continues unabated. Tossed up on off stump, and Mahela on-drives for two.
full length on off stump, played back to the bowler.
Mahela again gets a single past the bowler from middle and off line.
Chandimal defends a full ball to the off side.
drives a flighted ball straight to cover.
Chandimal tries to lap sweep from outside off, and gets a single away
flighted outside off stump, Chandimal plays it into the off side.
adjusts to a length ball on the stumps and defends.
covers the line as Doherty gets one to straighten from outside off.
good over so far. Chandimal defends from the crease to the off side.
tossed up on the stumps, blocked again.
maiden to the X-man. Chandimal is kept crease-bound by a length ball outside off and blocks again.
angled down the leg side, and Mahela tickles it along to fine leg for a couple.

uh oh, great fielding followed by an overthrow. Mahela drives a full ball to cover and takes off for a tight single. Warner dives to his left and behind to stop it and throws it even as he turned around on the turf before getting onto the feet. The throw was miles off target and they get the second.
Mahela pushes a single in front of square.
nudged off the pads to the leg side for one.
Mahela pushes another single, through wide mid-off now.
tossed up slow and loopy outside off, Chandimal drives past the covers now for a single.
Chandimal gets a single, pushing Doherty down past mid on for one.

a great ball to end what was promising to become a great innings. Doherty slows up the release, gets the ball to land just short of a length outside off, grip and spin. So far, Mahela has been adept at reaching the pitch and lofting over the off side, or pushing through for singles. This time too he was looking to reach out, but was about a foot away from where the ball landed. It spun sharply, past him as he overbalanced and into Wade's gloves. Out stumped by a classy delivery.
flighted on the stumps, Thirimanne works a single to the leg side.
tossed up on middle, Chandimal nudges behind square for a single.
loopy ball spins in from outside off. Thirimanne drives it into the covers.
angled in from wide of the crease. Chandimal defends down the track.
Clarke flights the ball outside the off stump, Thirimanne pushes into the covers for one.
Chandimal runs superbly to get two. Works a length ball off the pads very gently and takes off. Up and down in a flash.
slows the release again, Chandimal is partially foxed in the flight but defends.
needless overthrow yet again. Chandimal pushes into the covers and quickly returns to the crease. Warner picks up and under-arms the stumps, and the ricochet is not backed up.
Thirimanne leans across and works a length ball to the leg side.
flighted wide of off stump, Chandimal drives through extra cover for one.
tossed up to Chandimal, he jumps out and drives to mid-on.
works a ball from off stump line with the spin to the leg side.
leans across and laps a ball from outside off towards fine leg.
flighted ball outside off, pushed into the off side again.
keeps him in the crease. Chandimal defends a ball that straightens down the line.
defended again off the front foot.
poor start, a loosener that slips yards wide of off stump.

Thirimanne presses across to drive into the off side and gets a thick outside edge that goes down and past slip. Harris fields at third man, and as he goes down his knee gets stuck in the turf and pulls out a huge divot. Ouch.
length ball outside off stump, Thirimanne defends solidly.
gets across and on-drives the slow offcutter uppishly to the left of the bowler
back of a length, Thirimanne defends to point with an angled face.
wild drive, away from the body and in the air, but Thirimanne manages to elude the catchers on the off side even as he loses the grip of the bat.
Thirimanne skips out, gets too close to the pitch and then just jams the ball dead. And goes back into the crease.
straight ball slipping down the leg. It goes off the pad for a leg bye.
gets the single away, tight for Chandimal, with a careful dab in front of square.
Thirimanne works it off the pads to the leg side for one.
Chandimal works a single down the ground.
Thirimanne works off the pads straight to midwicket to end the over.
short of a length outside off stump, Chandimal steers through backward point for one.
Thirimanne gets a quick single now, dabbing softly wide of point. These two run quite well together.
back of a length, chopped through backward point for a single.
slower ball, cuts away from Thirimanne who can't get bat on ball as he tries to drive.
length ball on the pads, nudged to Lee at mid-on, and they steal another single.
singles being taken from every corner of the field. Chandimal drops this one towards point and sets off.
full ball from Clarke on the stumps, Chandimal drives through mid-on.
Thirimanne skips out to the flight and works a full ball back to Clarke.
opens the face and dabs from outside off towards backward point.
too short, Chandimal had time to wait and cart it to deep midwicket for one.
Thirimanne steers another ball softly into the point area for one.
flighted on the stumps, driven straight to mid-on.
flighted from round the stumps, Thirimanne thumps it on the up through the covers for a couple.
angled in, worked with the angle towards the square leg area.
gets the single this time, behind the square leg area with the nudge.
Thirimanne takes a start. What's new.. Full ball on the stumps, Chandmal drives it back to Hussey.
short ball outside off, Chandimal waits and hacks it through cover for a single.
Chandimal pushes to cover for another single.
Thirimanne now,m dabbing to cover point for one.
Chandimal tries to launch Clarke over the leg side, but mistimes it. Only a single to the deep.
Thirimanne stays in the crease and dabs to point for a single.
angled in towards the pads, Chandimal gets another single with a dink behind square.
short of a length outside off stump, Chandimal glides it down to third man for one.
angled across, Thirimanne uses the pace to steer with an opened face through backward point.
slow bouncer to Chandimal, who pulls it down and fine for yet another fifty. The future of SL batting is here.
length ball from round the stumps, Thirimanne was trying to bang it down the ground but couldn't get it away.
Thirimanne backs away and tries to carve a full ball into the off side. But he plays it straight to mid-off.

the straight drive always works wonders in the Powerplay, with mid-on and mid-off invariably up. Full ball on the stumps, Thirimanne plasters it ramrod straight right back past Lee for four. Boundary after a very long time.
short of a length and angling in, Chandimal hops and tucks it square for a single.
short of a length, Thirimanne charges out and looks for room but there is none. Played straight to cover.
sudden moment of aggression from Chandimal. He sets himself up in the crease and looks to launch a length ball over the leg side. Doesn't time the shot well enough to hole out.
back of a length and tucks him up, Chandimal works it around for a single to square leg.

Gets across his stumps, gets cheeky and gets out. Powerplay does the damage. Sri Lanka were strolling home, but Thirimanne tries to make the Powerplay count, and perishes. He's lapped a length ball straight to short fine leg. Australia have a vital opening.
back of a length on the stumps, defended from the crease carefully.
short ball, Chandimal tries to jump and whack it and misses. Sri Lanka can do with some cool heads at the moment.
short and quick again, 143 kph outside off. Chandimal tries to steer fine now, though he didn't have the room for the shot. Play and a miss.

short ball, Chandimal skips and nudges to the leg side for a single. Chandimal seems to be struggling. He is on his haunches. Ah, he's played this ball onto his ribs, which is the source of the pain..
full ball on off stump, Mathews drives down the ground solidly.
short ball on the stumps, pulled past midwicket for a single.
smacked it. Lee goes short and wide, Mathews waves his arms at it and sends it dribbling through the covers. Solid punchy drive away from the body.
short of a length outside off, Chandimal drops it quietly to the off side.
pitched up wide of off stump, Mathews mishits the drive back down the track.
full-pitched on the stumps, driven down to long-on for one.
short of a length, Chandimal tries to hack it into the covers but can't time it at all.
Chandimal goes over the top. He prances down the track and heaves a length ball over mid-off. Safe shot for the field, and he connects well enough to get four for it.

four more! Chandimal is shining bright. He swivels inside the line now and pulls with class, backward of square for four more. He worked the wrists perfectly for that shot, and played it down even as he generated the pace to send it to the boundary.
short of a length outside off, Mathews defends to the off side from the crease.
on a length outside off, played back down the track watchfully.
over-pitched on off stump, Chandimal drives off the toe of the bat to mid-off.
short of a length, Chandimal hangs back and clatters it away through the covers for a single.
almost a yorker from Lee, Chandimal tries to shovel-drive down the ground, but plays it straight to mid-on.
short from Lee, Chandimal pulls resourcefully for a single to deep midwicket. Powerplay out of the way.
tossed up outside off, pushed into the covers.
slowed up on the stumps, and it breaks away sharply. Mathews opens the face and defends to the off side.
gets the single now, pushed into the gap for one.
Chandimal plays a length ball back down the track.
leading edge. Chandimal goes back in the crease and looks to work from outside off to the leg side. The ball squirts to the off side off the edge.
angled into the pads, and Mathews gets a single through the leg side with a tuck.
another single taken off the pads, nudged with the angle through square leg.
back of a length, on Mathews pads and there's another single to the leg side.
slow offcutter, Chandimal drops it to the off side and they eventually set off for a quick single.
full toss wasted. Mathews whips straight to mid-on.
short of a length outside off, Chandimal hacks it square for a single.
pitched up outside off stump, defended off the front foot to mid-off.
slow through the air, holds the length back as Chandimal skips out. He defends it down the track in the end.
over-pitched and wide, Chandimal misses out! He slams the drive straight to cover.

whoa, he plays a Dilscoop so daring even Dishan may not have played it. He leans out to a full ball outside off and scoops it over Wade's head. Would have looked utterly stupid if that had resulted in a wicket,
tight single, but he escapes. Pushed into the covers and he sets off for a tight run. Australia miss the stumps again. Would have been tight.

Chandimal flexes his muscle. He isn't the best six-hitter in the game, and often tends to heave these across the line. This time, there was a gap between midwicket and long on, and he found it perfectly.
tries another needlessly cheeky shot. Pressure! Tries to walk across and lap a quick ball, but can't get it away.
full toss on the stumps, Chandimal tries to force to the leg side and it goes off the inner edge towards backward square leg for one.
Mathews quietly turns the strike with a nudge to the leg side.
bumper at 141 kph, Chandimal takes him on. He doesn't time it, and gets away with the pull.. There was a man at deep midwicket.
over-pitched outside off, Mathews drives to mid-off for a single.
low full toss on the stumps, Mathews drives through mid-on for a single.

Ryano has done the damage, Chandimal pays the price for playing strange strokes under pressure. He walks across the stumps to a straight ball and tries to dink it square. Harris kept it straight and full and rapped him dead in front of the stumps. End of a good innings, but Chandimal needs to learn how to finish the job.
full length ball to Maharoof, he works it to midwicket quietly.
full ball angled into the leg stump area, Maharoof clips it square for a single.
full length once again, Mathews plays with a very straight bat through mid-on for one.
Maharoof's turn to shot the full face and take a single down the ground off a length ball.
back of a length on the hips, Maharoof dabs expertly with a turn of the wrists and sprints the couple.
on a length, Maharoof plays solidly to mid-on.
back of a length, heaved from outside off towards square leg for a single.
short of a length from Hilf, Mathews defends to the off side and takes another easy single.

uh oh, Maharoof implodes. He gets inside the line of a short ball slipping into the body and plays a ginger uppish pull in the air. He almost got away with it too, but Harris managed to back-pedal quickly from about 20 yards in front of the ropes at 45 degrees and hold on to a well-judged catch.
length ball to Mathews, he looks to push a single to the off side but can't get it away.
low full toss, but he gets away with it. Thisara drives it back hard down the ground, past Harris' half-stop for a single.
full ball sliding onto leg stump, Mathews nudges a single to midwicket.
very full on off stump at 139 kph. Thisara plays it back to the bowler.
low full toss now, Thisara whips it to midwicket and they might have contemplated two. Mathews isn't interested.
Mathews nearly holes out! He tries to get under the length and shovel Harris over long-on, and nearly picked out the fielder. It landed some yards in front of him eventually.

Thisara has put the cheek in cheeky shot-making. He shuffles across the stumps, gets under a low Harris full toss and laps it off the middle of the bat behind square leg. He didn't try to go over the fielder at short fine-leg, and instead just went well outside his range. Much squarer than the shot Thirimanne was attempting.
full ball on the stumps, driven hard through mid-on for a single.

another leading edge. Thisara tries to nudge to leg from outside off and the ball skims off the edge towards third man. Ohho, he charges back for the second and puts the dive in to beat Harris' throw to the keeper. He's in.
near yorker on middle and leg, Thisara drags it through mid-on for a single.

full toss from Lee, Sri Lanka are running like professional sprinters here! Thisara makes Forrest sweat in the deep after Mathews drove into the covers. He charged back for the second and made it easy.
near yorker, Mathews can't get it away for a single. Lee collects and thinks of throwing at the keeper's end. He resists and just glares!
another dot ball! Mathews is unable to get a yorker away and Lee moves across to field. He even under-arms a throw at Thisara's end as he backs up too far. But Thisara is in, and Lee misses.
near perfect yorker, lands outside leg and hits the pad as Perera misses the heave to leg. He was through the shot too early. Leg bye taken.

Mathews is holing out straight down the throats of the gaps in the outfield! Juicy full toss on the pads, Mathews tries to cart it over midwicket, but doesn't time it well enough. He mistimes it sufficiently for it to land short of long-on and midwicket who were converging.

Gone! Mathews has perished trying another big shot. He was trying to haul the length ball over the extra cover area, but the slower ball hoodwinked him into another miscue. It landed in long-off's hands as he came across.

Thisara doesn't need two hands to get the boundary. Full length slower ball on the leg stump line, he was lining up the loft over the leg side, but the ball came on after he was into the stroke. No matter. The top hand came off, he continued with the swing and ended up slapping it square rather than through midwicket.

Thisara!!! Sri Lanka are roaring home after a six followed by a four. Thisara plants the front foot across, gets clean under the length ball and bombards it deep over the midwicket boundary for a six. Sri Lanka can't possibly lose from here.
he gets a single now, squeezes it away to the leg side and keeps strike. 14 off the over, the over that has probably lose it for Australia.
full ball on the pads, Thisara whips it behind square and they get a single ... Thisara wants a second, but they have to settle for one.

Sri Lanka are on top of the table! Take that says Kula. He stays beside the line to a length ball and cracks it through the covers for four. Sri Lanka have been undefeated four games in a row, and I daresay they look the best side in this tournament.
